column4: can any1 get the nvidia beta drivers working without losing dual core cpu compatability and frequency scaling?
the drives should mess with the smp of the kernel
did u mean shouldent mess with?
well they do...when I do an apt-get install nvidia-glx it install kernal 2.6.17-386 as well.
did you install the beta drivers from nvidia's website? or a package?

yes I installed with the aptitude command you gave me, it installed the nvidia -glx beta drivers but the restricted modules was allready on the system so it did not do an install for them when i ran your aptitude command.
u need to upgrade the linux-restricted-modules package as well
how do i check which version of each is installed?
"Installed: 2.6.17.10  Candidate: 2.6.17.10  Version table: *** 2.6.17.10 0        500 http://za.archive.ubuntu.com edgy/restricted Packages        100 /var/lib/dpkg/status
thanks..sorry for the newb questions......ive just stopped using gentoo and gone over to ubuntu..so learning curve is a factor.

The following packages will be upgraded:  linux-restricted-modules-2.6.17-10-generic   linux-restricted-modules-common  is it ok to do the common as well, I dont want to break the core 2 smp support again?
